info.title: Container Tracking API
info.description:
This documentation defines how the users can utilize the Portcast API to retrieve the latest Track and Trace Data for any container, bill of lading or booking across 100+ carriers and 2500+ ports across the globe.

What's changed in the version 2.0?
Find out more about it [here](https://support.portcast.io/support/solutions/articles/151000074289-api-release-notes-april-2023-)!!

tags.name: Get tracking data for uploaded containers
Sub-APIs
tags.description: Endpoint to get more granular detailed visibility data

200.description:
#### Upload Successful

Once the container is successfully uploaded the API Responds with the Bill of Lading Bookmark Object.

The bill of lading bookmark object consists of the metadata for your upload.

Key features to note for the same:
- The ID returned is the primary key which helps us identify each unique upload in our system and can help you retrieve the latest tracking data for the same. This ID is also called as Bill of Lading Bookmark ID or Bookmark ID.
- The created timestamp defines when the bookmark was created.
- The updated timestamp defines when the bookmark was last refreshed, i.e. when we retrieved the tracking information last for the bookmark.
- The status defines at which stage of the journey the bookmark is on.
- Org ID defines which flow/customer org the bookmark is created in.

400.description:
#### Bad Request

Could be triggered due to the following case conditions:
- Invalid Payload
    - Triggered when the payload provided in the request doesn't follow the API requirements, could be because of non-null contrainsts or missing/incorrect payload key names
    - Resolution: Make sure the keys in the payload are correct and the carrier_no, bl_no, cntr_no are not null.
- Invalid Carrier_no
    - Triggered when the provided carrier_no is not a valid SCAC code, or it doesn't belong to the scac synonyms
    - Resolution: Ensure that you're using a portcast supported SCAC or SCAC Synonmyn in the payload.
- Invalid Container Number
    - Triggered when the container number provided doesn't follow the ISO 6346 standards
    - Resolution: Ensure that the container number used to make the upload follows the [ISO 6346 standards](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_6346#Check_digit)

enum: invalid payload, please refer to the detailed schema in documentation

value.message: invalid payload, please refer to the detailed schema in documentation

401.description:
#### Unauthorized Access You've provided an incorrect API Key.
**Resolution:**
Please check your API Key. Refer to the [before you begin section of the Quick Start Guide.](docs/Quick_Start_Guide.md)

403.description:
#### API Quota Exceeded API Quota for the org is finished.
**Resolution:**
For further assistance, please reach out to your account manager or support@portcast.io

409.description:
#### Duplicate Upload ~ Record Already Exists A bookmark with the same Carrier-BL/Booking Number-Container Number combination exists in the same org. **Resolution:**
The API responds with the Bookmark ID for the same, which can be used to fetch the data.

previous_ids.description: List of Existing Bookmark IDs for the Carrier-BL-Container Combination

500.description:
#### Internal Server Error These could be due to: - Data Sources aren't responding - Error in Bookmark Creation process - Internal Database errors **Resolution:**
For further assistance, please reach out to your account manager or support@portcast.io

post.description:
*To track shipment, you need to provide three inputs:*

- Carrier SCAC code: This helps us to identify which carrier to fetch the data from, use AUTO if you don't know. If AUTO is used the bill of lading number is disregarded, only container number is used and the data return is for the latest journey of the container.
- Bill of Lading or Booking Number: This helps us to fetch the correct journey along with detailed tracking data
- Container Number: This helps us to identify which container you intend to track within the Booking

Incase of any missing inputs, refer to [Input Data Guide](docs/Input_Data_Guide.md) for more details!

parameters.name: x-customer
parameters.description: [Enterprise Customers] Customer Name to indicate which org to upload too

carrier_no.description: Carrier SCAC Code or Carrier Synonym (AUTO Detection Supported)

bl_no.description: Carrier Provided Master Bill of Lading Number or Booking Number [Leave blank if not available]

callback_url.description: A https endpoint for Portcast to push the json object whenever there are updates.

200.description:
#### Upload Successful

The API Responds with the list of containers that are uploaded, along with the response object which would consist of the Bill of lading bookmark object for each container, the ID provided with in each Bill of Lading Bookmark object would be used to fetch the tracking data for the respective container.

In case of any error within the process, the same would be highlighted in the message object of the response. The details for the same can be found in: [Status Codes](https://portcast.stoplight.io/docs/portcast-api/jm8coczry4gxb-status-codes#booking-api-statuses)

If the bookmark for a container already exists in our system, then the API responds with the Bookmark ID for that container within the response object.

In addition to the same, this endpoint also shares some metadata for the booking:
- The route of the shipments along with POL, POD, pre-POL and post-POD locations
- Locations metadata for the ports the shipment goes through
- Vessels metadata for the vessels that the shipments interact with

400.description:
#### Bad Request

Could be triggered due to the following case conditions:
- Invalid Payload
    - Triggered when the payload provided in the request doesn't follow the API requirements, could be because of non-null contrainsts or missing/incorrect payload key names
    - Resolution: Make sure the keys in the payload are correct and the carrier_no, doc_no, doc_type are not null.
- Invalid Carrier_no
    - Triggered when the provided carrier_no is not a valid SCAC code, or it doesn't belong to the scac synonyms
    - Resolution: Ensure that you're using a portcast supported SCAC or SCAC Synonmyn in the payload.

500.description:
#### Internal Server Error These could be due to: - Data Sources aren't responding - Error in Bookmark Creation process - Internal Database errors **Resolution:**
For further assistance, please reach out to your account manager or support@portcast.io

post.description:
To initiate tracking any booking or bill of lading, when you do not have the container numbers, you can use this API to trigger an upload and start tracking the containers within that booking!

This API automatically fetches the container numbers which are a part of the Booking or Bill of Lading provided by you and start tracking the same.

When the containers are fetched, we upload them on our end and share back the [Bill of Lading Bookmark](../reference/PortcastAPI.json/components/schemas/Bill_of_Lading_Bookmark) object for your reference which can then be used to fetch tracking data for those containers.

To initiate an upload, you need to provide three inputs:
- Carrier SCAC Code: The carrier SCAC code which helps us identify which carrier to fetch the data from
- Document Number: Bill of Lading or Booking Number which helps us fetch the containers
- Document Type: This helps us identify if the doc no provided is a booking number or a bill of lading number 

Supported carriers can be found [here](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1l7eA1brGaEZwhUS1_xwq1puyK35maPN0T-DWwNJvnhI).

parameters.description: [Enterprise Customers] Customer Name to indicate which org to upload too
parameters.name: x-customer

carrier_no.description: Carrier SCAC Code or Carrier Synonym (AUTO Detection Supported)

doc_no.description: Booking or Bill of Lading number

doc_type.description: Document number type: BK (Booking) or BL (Bill of Lading)

callback_url.description: A https endpoint for Portcast to push the json object whenever there are updates.

get.summary: List Tracking data by Container, Bill of Lading or Carrier
tags: Get tracking data for uploaded containers

200.description:
#### Successfully queried for Tracking Data

If there are any results for the query the API will respond with an array of dictionaries which would contain the tracking data for each and every Bookmark which complies with the query parameters.

Incase there are no results for the query, the response will consist of an empty array.

400.description:
#### Bad Request Could be triggered if the _start_after_ provided is invalid and doesn't follow the uuid4 standards. **Resolution:**
Please use the correct bookmark ID to be able to resolve the following error For any further assistance, please reach out to your account manager or support@portcast.io

message.default: Invalid _start_after value. Should be a bookmark ID

401.description:
#### Unauthorized Access You've provided an incorrect API Key.
**Resolution:**
Please check your API Key. Refer to the [before you begin section of the Quick Start Guide.](docs/Quick_Start_Guide.md)

parameters.name: bl_no
parameters.description: Bill of Lading or Booking Number
[Enterprise Customers] Customer Name to indicate which org to get tracking data from
parameters.name: x-customer

get.description:
Returns a list of your Tracking Data for the Bookmarks based on your query. The tracking requests are returned sorted by creation date, with the most recent tracking request appearing first. 

The list API doesn't return tracking data for more than 5 bookmarks, hence there's pagination which is applied on the same!

get.summary: Fetch tracking data by Bookmark ID
tags: Get tracking data for uploaded containers

200.description:
#### Successfully retreived the tracking data
The API result consists of 4 major parts:
1. Bill of Lading Bookmark: Summary of the Bookmark ID metadata
2. Bill of Lading: Summary of major events that happen at POL and POD
3. Container Events List: List of various container events received from the carrier, For more details refer to the [detailed container events explaination](docs/Container_Events_Data_Types.md)
4. Sailing Info Tracking: An array of different legs of the journey along with a summary of major events that take place there. This also consists of a detailed schedule

400.description:
#### Bad Request Could be triggered if the Bookmark ID provided is invalid and doesn't follow the uuid4 standards. **Resolution:**
Please use [query the endpoint](../reference/PortcastAPI.json/paths/~1tracking~1bill-of-lading-bookmarks/get) for the said Booking or Container to get the tracking data and identify the correct Bookmark ID. For any further assistance, please reach out to your account manager or support@portcast.io

401.description:
#### Unauthorized Access You've provided an incorrect API Key.
**Resolution:**
Please check your API Key. Refer to the [before you begin section of the Quick Start Guide.](docs/Quick_Start_Guide.md)

404.description:
#### Bill of Lading ID not Found Could be triggered if the Bookmark ID provided is not found. **Resolution:**
Please use [query the endpoint](../reference/PortcastAPI.json/paths/~1tracking~1bill-of-lading-bookmarks/get) for the said Booking or Container to get the tracking data and identify the correct Bookmark ID. In case you're an enterprise customer with multiple API keys, Please make sure that you're using the API key for the correct customer org or are using the currect `x-customer` name in the header. For any further assistance, please reach out to your account manager or support@portcast.io

Example 1.error: Record not found with give Org/Bill Of Lading ID
Example 1.message: You have requested this URI [/api/v1/eta/tracking/bill-of-lading-bookmarks/e48cb2fb-499b-4af4-a0ef-250eac4eee5f] but did you mean /api/v1/eta/tracking/bill-of-lading-bookmarks/<bill_of_lading_bookmark_id> or /api/v1/eta/tracking/bill-of-lading-bookmarks or /api/v1/orgs/<org_id>/eta/tracking/bill-of-lading-bookmarks ?

error.default: Record not found with give Org/Bill Of Lading ID

message.default: You have requested this URI [/api/v1/eta/tracking/bill-of-lading-bookmarks/e48cb2fb-499b-4af4-a0ef-250eac4eee5f] but did you mean /api/v1/eta/tracking/bill-of-lading-bookmarks/<bill_of_lading_bookmark_id> or /api/v1/eta/tracking/bill-of-lading-bookmarks or /api/v1/orgs/<org_id>/eta/tracking/bill-of-lading-bookmarks ?

get.description: Fetch the tracking data using the Bookmark ID.

parameters.description: [Enterprise Customers] Customer Name to indicate which org to get tracking data from
parameters.name: x-customer

get.summary: Fetch terminal data by Bookmark ID

200.description:
#### Successfully retreived the tracking data
The API result consists of two major parts:
1. Export Plan: export milestones (Gate In) and deadlines (ERD, CY cut-off) at the Port of Loading (POL);
2. Import Plan: import milestones (Discharged, Gate Out, Last Free Day) and statuses (customs clearance, holds and available for pick up) at the Port of Discharge (POD).

400.description:
#### Bad Request Could be triggered if the Bookmark ID provided is invalid and doesn't follow the uuid4 standards. Or, if there the Port or Vessel isn't fonud for the said bookmark! **Resolution:**
Please use [query the endpoint](../reference/PortcastAPI.json/paths/~1tracking~1bill-of-lading-bookmarks/get) for the said Booking or Container to get the tracking data and identify the correct Bookmark ID. For any further assistance, please reach out to your account manager or support@portcast.io

get.description:
Enhance your supply chain visibility by ingesting terminal-specific data. 

Once you upload your container into Portcast system, use the Bill of Lading Bookmark ID to fetch terminal data for that container. 

Refer to this [coverage sheet](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1l7eA1brGaEZwhUS1_xwq1puyK35maPN0T-DWwNJvnhI/edit#gid=118367482) for a detailed overview of the supported fields and the latest terminal coverage.

To enable this add-on, contact us at support@portcast.io.

parameters.description: [Enterprise Customers] Customer Name to indicate which org to get tracking data from
parameters.name: x-customer

200.description:
## Successful Operation

The provided Bookmark ID has been archived successfully.

#### Bad Request Could be triggered if the Bookmark ID provided is invalid and doesn't follow the uuid4 standards. **Resolution:**

In case you're an enterprise customer with multiple API keys, Please make sure that you're using the API key for the correct customer org or are using the currect `x-customer` name in the header. For any further assistance, please reach out to your account manager or support@portcast.io

delete.description:
Archive a container Bookmark to stop tracking it.

This will remove the container from the refresh processes and archive the shipment.

parameters.name: x-customer
parameters.description: [Enterprise Customers] Customer Name to indicate which org the bookmark belongs to

200.description: Successfully responded with the supported SCAC codes

scac_synonyms.description: Other SCAC Synonyms for the carrier (If upload operation is done using any of these, we will convert it to the official SCAC)

supported_status.description: Supported Status for the carrier, will highlight here if there are any gaps for a particular carrier's coverage.

get.description: API Endpoint to fetch a list of all the supported carrier SCACs for Ocean Container Visibility

bill_of_lading.description: Summary of the shipment's Predicted, Scheduled and Actual Events that happen at the POL and POD

bill_of_lading_bookmark.description: Summary of the Bookmark ID Metadata

container_event_list.description: Container Events List for the tracked shipment

total.description:
Total emissions for each container: 
(gm/ TEU)

Sum of the emissions derived from WTT and TTW analyses. This offers the carbon footprint associated with the entire lifecycle of the shipped goods.

wtt.description:
Well-to-Tank (WTT) monitoring: 
(gm/ TEU)

Measurement of carbon emissions across the entire fuel supply chain; that is, the energy required to extract, produce, and transport a fuel from its source.

ttw.description:
Tank-to-Wheels (TTW) monitoring: 
(gm/ TEU)

Measurement of emissions generated during the actual vessel operation, providing a real-time understanding of carbon output during voyages.

intensity.description:
Co2e intensity: 
(kg/ ton-km)

Signifies the carbon efficiency for each container, thus empowering stakeholders to define actions on reducing emissions.

response_id.description: Unique ID for the API response generated

msg.example: Obtained latest bill of lading and container tracking information

org_id.description: Customer Org (Flow) to which the bookmark ID is uploaded too

sailing_info_tracking.description: Detailed Tracking Information for each leg of the journey

status_info.description: Status Defination Object for the [API Response](docs/Portcast-Status-Codes.md)

Bill_of_Lading_Bookmark.description: Schema for the Bill of Lading Bookmark Object
Bill_of_Lading_Bookmark.title: Bill of Lading Bookmark

bl_no.description: Bill of Lading No or Booking No.

id.description: Unique Identifier called Bill of Lading Bookmark ID [Primary Key] (Also refered as Bookmark ID)

org_id.description: Customer Org (Flow) to which the bookmark ID is uploaded too

status_info.description: Status Defination Object for container tracking journey stage

system_deleted.description: System Deletion Status of the bookmark

updated.description:
Last Updated date for the Bookmark ID
(Refers to when we fetched the latest data for the bookmark ID)

Container_Event.description: Schema for Container Events; Refer to [Container Events Detail Docs](docs/Container_Events_Data_Types.md) for more details
Container_Event.title: Container Event

event_raw.description: Description of the event, as reported by the Carrier

event_time.description: The latest actual date-time of the event, as reported by the Carrier - Local Time

event_time_estimated.description: The latest estimated date-time of the event, as reported by the Carrier - Local Time

id.description: Unique Identifier for the Container Event Object

location_raw.description: Relates to a physical location where the container event takes place, as reported by the Carrier

location_type_code.description: Describes the stage at which the container event takes place - Code

location_type_name.description: Describes the stage at which the container event takes place - Full Description

mode_of_transport.description: Mode of Transport which is used for the execution of the container event, as interpretted by Portcast

port_code.description: Relates to the UNLOCODE for the location where the container event takes place, as standardized by Portcast

port_name.description: Relates to the location name where the container event takes place, as standardized by Portcast

terminal_details.description: Terminal Level Details for the container event

terminal_code.description: BIC/SMDG Defined Code for the Terminal Location

terminal_name.description: Terminal Name where the container event takes place

vessel_imo.description: Vessel IMO of the vessel associated with the event

vessel_name.description: Vessel Name of the vessel associated with the event

detail_st.description: Container Size and Type Code as defined by [ISO 6346](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_6346#Size_and_type_codes)

Delay_Reasons.title: Delay Reasons
Delay_Reasons.description: Schema for delay reasons associated to the bookmark; Refer to [Delay Reasons Detail Docs](docs/Delay_Reasons_and_Incidents.md) for more details

created.description: Container Delay Reason Object Created Date

enum: Container rolled over to another vessel at POL
Container rolled over to another vessel at POT

location_type_code.description: Location qualifier to define if the delay incident has taken place at the origin port (POL) or transshipment port (POT)

port_code.description: Relates to the UNLOCODE for the location to which the delay incident is associated with

port_name.description: Relates to the location name to which the delay incident is associated with

reason_code.description: Delay Incident Code: RLV(Vessel Rollover), LTD(Late Departure), PRC(Port Rotation Changes)

rotation_change.description: Detailed view into the vessel schedule changes

comparison_schedule.description: Last recorded schedule information - Ports Order

updated_schedule.description: Latest changed schedule information - Ports Order

schedule_change.description: Detailed view into impact of delay incidents into the container's arrival at POD, loading and departure events.

event_type_code.description: Defines if it's a loading, departure or arrival event

location_type_code.description: Defines if the change is happening at the POL, POT or POD

new_date.description: Latest changed datetime information - port local time

old_date.description: Last recorded datetime information - port local time

vessel_change.description: Detailed view into the change in vessels

comparison_vessel.description: IMO for the last recorded vessel

updated_vessel.description: IMO for the latest recorded vessel

ais.description: AIS Data for the vessel at this leg of the journey

timestamp_utc.description: Timestamp for when the AIS Data was fetched

sailing_info.description: Details for this specific leg of the journey

id.description: Unique Identifier for the Sailing Info

imo.description: Vessel IMO for the Vessel associated with this specific journey leg

is_active.description: Defines if the sailing info is active/latest or not

pod.description: Target Location UNLOCODE for this specific leg of the journey

pod_actual_arrival_lt.description: Actual Arrival Time at the target port location - Local Time

pod_actual_arrival_lt_from_ais.description: Actual Arrival Time at the target port location as per AIS Data - Local Time

pod_actual_departure_lt_from_ais.description: Actual Departure Time from the target port location as per AIS Data - Local Time

pod_actual_discharge_lt.description: Actual Time of Discharge at the target port location - Local Time

pod_name.description: Target Location Name for this specific leg of the journey

pod_predicted_arrival_lt.description: Portcast Predicted Time of Arrival at the target port location - Local Time

pod_predicted_departure_lt.description: Portcast Predicted Time of Departure from the target port location - Local Time

pod_scheduled_arrival_lt.description: Scheduled Time of Arrival at the target port location - Local Time

pod_scheduled_arrival_lt_from_schedule.description: Scheduled Time of Arrival at the target port location as per Vessel Schedule - Local Time

pod_scheduled_departure_lt_from_schedule.description: Scheduled Time of Departure from the target port location as per Vessel Schedule - Local Time

pod_scheduled_discharge_lt.description: Scheduled Discharge Time at the target port location - Local Time

pod_terminal_name.description: Terminal Name for the Target Port for this specific leg of the journey

pol.description: Starting Location UNLOCODE for this specific leg of the journey

pol_actual_arrival_lt_from_ais.description: Actual Time of Arrival at the starting port location as per AIS Data - Local Time

pol_actual_departure_lt.description: Actual Time of Departure from the starting port location - Local Time

pol_actual_departure_lt_from_ais.description: Actual Time of Departure from the starting port location as per AIS Data - Local Time

pol_actual_loading_lt.description: Actual Loading Time at the starting port location - Local Time

pol_name.description: Starting Location Name for this specific leg of the journey

pol_predicted_arrival_lt.description: Portcast Predicted Time of Arrival at the starting port location - Local Time

pol_predicted_departure_lt.description: Portcast Predicted Time of Departure from the starting port location - Local Time

pol_scheduled_arrival_lt_from_schedule.description: Scheduled Time of Arrival at the starting port location as per Vessel Schedule- Local Time

pol_scheduled_departure_lt.description: Scheduled Time of Departure from the starting port location - Local Time

pol_scheduled_departure_lt_from_schedule.description: Scheduled Time of Departure from the starting port location as per Vessel Schedule - Local Time

pol_scheduled_loading_lt.description: Scheduled Loading Time at the starting port location - Local Time

pol_terminal_name.description: Terminal Name for the Port of Loading (POL)

vessel_flag.description: Vessel Name for the Vessel Flag for the vessel associated with this specific journey leg

vessel_leg.description: Defines which leg of the journey this sailing info is for

vessel_name.description: Vessel Name for the Vessel associated with this specific journey leg

voyage_no.description: Voyage Number associated with this specific journey leg (From container track and trace data) [Most reliable]

status_info.description: Status Defination for Vessel Schedules and Portcast Predictions for this leg of the journey

prediction.description: Status Defination related to the [Prediction Engine](docs/Portcast-Status-Codes.md)

vessel.description: Status Defination related to the [Vessel Schedules](docs/Portcast-Status-Codes.md)

voyage_details.description: Sailing Schedule for the vessel between the starting and target port of this specific leg of the journey

enum: Cannot find vessel live ais data (before the time specified)

success.description: Successfully Fetched AIS data or not

actual_arrival_lt.description: Actual Time of Arrival - Local Time

actual_arrival_utc.description: Actual Time of Arrival - UTC Adjusted Time

actual_departure_lt.description: Actual Time of Departure - Local Time

actual_departure_utc.description: Actual Time of Departure - UTC Adjusted Time

items.example: Expected waiting time at port NORFOLK is 26.91 hours

id.description: Unique Identifier for the Voyage Detail

predicted_arrival_lt.description: Portcast Predicted Arrival Time - Local Time

predicted_arrival_utc.description: Portcast Predicted Arrival Time - UTC Adjusted

predicted_departure_lt.description: Portcast Predicted Departure Time - Local Time

predicted_departure_utc.description: Portcast Predicted Departure Time - UTC Adjusted Time

scheduled_arrival_lt.description: Vessel Scheduled Arrival Time - Local Time

scheduled_arrival_utc.description: Vessel Scheduled Arrival Time - UTC Adjusted Time

scheduled_departure_lt.description: Vessel Scheduled Departure Time - Local Time

scheduled_departure_utc.description: Vessel Scheduled Departure Time - Departure Time

voyage_no_list.description: Voyage Numbers at the Port Location (Comes from schedule for that leg ; first one is import voyage number, second one is export voyage no)

message.description:
Key | Description
---------|----------
 SUCCESS | Successful call
 BL_NOT_FOUND | Carrier didn't return any data for the queried document 
 INVALID_BL_NO | Carrier returned an error for the queried document
 AUTO_CANT_DETECT_SEALINE | AUTO Scac detection wasn't able to get the correct carrier
 UNEXPECTED_ERROR | There was an error while fetching the document details, please check input parameters

response.description: Bill of Lading Bookmarks Created List

status.description: Status of the individual container upload

container.description: Container Number registered under the BL/Booking

previous_ids.description: List of Bookmark IDs registered for this container

container.description: Container Number registered under the BL/Booking

prepol.description: Pre-POL is the location where the container is stuffed

location.description: Location ID - Refer to location obj for details

date.description: Timestamp on when the first event takes place at the pre-POL

pol.description: POL is the location where the container is loaded on the vessel where it starts it's journey

location.description: Location ID - Refer to location obj for details

date.description: Timestamp on when the first event takes place at the POL

pod.description: POD is the location where the container is unloaded from the vessel at the final destination port

location.description: Location ID - Refer to location obj for details

date.description: Timestamp on when the first event takes place at the POD

postpod.description: Post-POD is the location where the container is destuffed

location.description: Location ID - Refer to location obj for details

date.description: Timestamp on when the first event takes place at the post-POD

locations.description: List of Locations the booking will visit

country_code.description: Country Code as per UN LOCODEs

locode.description: UN assigned LOCODE for the location

vessels.description: List of Vessels the booking will operate on

bill_of_lading_bookmark_id.description: Unique Identifier called Bill of Lading Bookmark ID [Primary Key] (Also refered as Bookmark ID)

bl_no.description: Bill of Lading or Booking Number

export_plan.description: Summry of key temrinal events and milestones at the export Port of Loading (POL).

id.description: Unique Identifier for the Export Plan Object.

port_code.description: Relates to the UNLOCODE for the export port, as standardized by Portcast

port_name.description: Relates to the export port name, as standardized by Portcast

facility_code.description: BIC/SMDG Defined Code for the Port Terminal Location

vessel_name.description: Vessel name of the vessel associated with the export location.

voyage_no.description: Voyage Number associated with the export journey, as reported by the Terminal.

erd_standard.description: Earliest Receipt Date (ERD) for a standard container, as reported by the terminal - Local Time.

erd_reefer.description: Earliest Receipt Date (ERD) for a reefer container, as reported by the terminal - Local Time.

gate_in_date.description: Date a container was received at the terminal through the gate, as reported by the terminal - Local Time.

port_cutoff_standard.description: Last possible date and time for gating-in standard container at the export terminal, as reported by the Terminal - Local Time.

port_cutoff_reefer.description: Last possible date and time for gating-in reefer container at the export terminal, as reported by the terminal - Local Time.

latest_eta.description: Latest vessel ETA to the export port, as reported by the terminal - Local Time.

actual_arrival.description: Actual vessel time of arrival, as reported by the terminal - Local Time.

latest_etd.description: Latest vessel ETD from the export port, as reported by the terminal - Local Time.

actual_departure.description: Actual vessel time of departure from the export port, as reported by the terminal - Local Time.

import_plan.description: Summry of key temrinal events and statuses at the import Port of Discharge (POD).

id.description: Unique Identifier for the Import Plan Object.

port_code.description: Relates to the UNLOCODE for the import port, as standardized by Portcast

port_name.description: Relates to the import port name, as standardized by Portcast.

facility_code.description: BIC/SMDG Defined Code for the Port Terminal Location.

vessel_name.description: Vessel name of the vessel associated with the import location.

voyage_no.description: Voyage Number associated with the import journey, as reported by the Terminal.

container_status.description: Container status, as reported by the Terminal.

discharge_date.description: Date and time when the container was discharged from the vessel, as reported by the Terminal - Local Time.

yard_location.description: Current location of the container in the yard.

container_holds.description: Identifies any holds that might be applicable to this shipment.

last_free_day.description: Last Free Day, as reported by the Terminal. Charges will start to acrue after this date.

demurrage_owed.description: Dollar amount owed in demurrage fees, as reported by the Terminal.

gate_out_date.description: Date and time when the container gates out of the port terminal, as reported by the Terminal - Local Time.

latest_eta.description: Latest vessel ETA, as reported by the Terminal - Local Time.

ready_for_delivery.description: Confirms if the container is ready for delivery.

appointment_set.description: Confirms if the pick up appointment has been set.

pickup_appointment_date.description: Date and time when container is scheduled to be picked up from the port, as reported by the Terminal - Local Time.
